tweets.text: Given that @EnvAgency (with the collusion of @NEYorksNLincs) is poised to destroy an irreplaceable grassland SSSI in York, maybe these organisations could investigate themselves at the same time? https://t.co/oQ6smyizKl

We have secured ¬£5,000 funding to test new technology in 2021 to trial removal of plastic nurdles from sensitive habitats in Chessel Bay #Southampton. If successful we will look to use this technology in this and other areas to help protect coastal habitats from #Microplastics https://t.co/0BRc5W9oW3

#Rickerby Flood Risk Management Scheme has reached completion

The scheme comprises 440m of new flood defence walls, 100m of raised flood embankment along with a new road alignment with improved hedges and tree planting for nature

#ReducingFloodRisk

Photo credit - @DrDWT https://t.co/Rt5OH3nmjj

tweets.text:
At this time of year wild brown trout and salmon are spawning, laying eggs in the gravels on riverbeds.

Even by walking up a river you will have utterly destroyed those incubating eggs. Guess what impact a bulldozer has.

https://t.co/8QES9U47dG

tweets.text: @RobStoneman @timthefruit @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency Ironically, Parish Council minutes from July meeting state that "...dredging can be done where there is a need, but need to keep in mind the dynamic nature of the river which moves the bed levels anyway (diverse nature of river flow)" #RiverLugg

Throughout the next few weeks, we will share key stats about the ¬£76mil Flood Risk Management Scheme in #Kendal which, when complete, will help better protect 1,480 homes & 1,151 business from #flooding.

Key information available on @thefloodhub & via https://t.co/F4fe5jNVEN https://t.co/ZcSyNT5Shq

tweets.text:
Time we heard from the @EnvAgency I think...

None of what is written here matches up to the scale of work carried out, but they need to comment ASAP.

Environment Agency faces questions over works on protected river https://t.co/VSEbyqzYc3

Just in case any walkers or river users in #Northumberland have recently noticed any dead or distressed #salmon  #seatrout in the #RiverCoquet - all is explained in the following story https://t.co/92cembDYD2 https://t.co/bmlFDKBeHl

urls.title: Environment Agency allays dead fish fears in River Coquet
urls.description: In the early winter months between November and January people are likely to see a large number of dead and dying salmon and sea trout in our region‚Äôs rivers.

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
This is more like it @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA Well done EA people - let's see what happens of course but you are through the door. https://t.co/Ef5clXXF2V

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Tune in to @BBCPanorama tonight at 7pm to find out more about climate change and the great flood resilience work in #Calderdale being carried out by a range of organisations and community groups. @EnvAgencyYNE @slowtheflow_UK @HardcastleNT #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/A2rV098n84
